page.title: 20HISTORICAL EVERCREECH
page.content:
THINGS OF HISTORICAL INTEREST IN THE EVERCREECH AREA. {SMALLDOWN HILL FORT}is at the top of Smalldown Hill.It has three incomplete banks and several interesting objects have been found there. There are the remains of a{ROMAN {TEMPLE}on the top of Creech Hill. Walls,pottery and bones were found when it was excavated. At Spargrove there is an old moated{MANOR HOUSE. Nearby are the remains of a lost village.These remains can only be seen clearly from the air.{THE SOMERSET AND {DORSET RAILWAY}used to run through the village.The remains of the embankments can still be seen.
{THIS IS THE WORK OF THE CHILDREN OF {CLASSES FOUR AND FIVE OF EVERCREECH {PRIMARY SCHOOL,SUMMER TERM 1985.
